Reviews.Title: “Relais P”
Reviews.Author: Matthew K Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very clean nice mid luxury hotel adjacent to the spanish steps. Stayed here for 4 nights and would definitely recommend it for the price point (approx. 200 euro a night). Hotel staff is extremely nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “This is our spot in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Marye1984
Reviews.Content: Should we ever travel to Rome again, we'd definitely return to Relais Pierret. The location cannot be beat! The staff, the rooms and the atmosphere we much preferred over the big hotel that we has stayed in the previsous five days of our stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1968
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 yo son and I spent 6 nights at this fabulous hotel. We had a triple delux room. It was generous in size for Rome in a perfect location just up from the Spanish steps. The atmosphere was great in the piazza and there was some sort of entertainment on every night.. Due to Christmas being a week away. You can walk to every major attraction from here. The staff (Guilia) was lovely and able to assist with any request. Breakfast was not included but with a choice of cafes a stone throw away it didn't matter. .. And shopping ... You are almost the best! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: labonnevie
Reviews.Content: Modern amenities amidst historical architecture with a location that is unparalleled. I have been going to this hotel since it opened and whenever I can, I choose it for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Marciachb
Reviews.Content: We really loved the hotel, for everything! We'll recommend it for sure to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Louise T
Reviews.Content: The Relais Pierret is a very quiet and discreet hotel. I believe there are only 8 rooms in the hotel, so it is very quiet. Although the reception area phone woke me up at 7am on a Sunday morning. I would recommend this hotel-residence to someone who appreciates lovely frescos and wants to feel like they are living 'like a Roman'. There are no restaurants or extras and the only staff you see is the person at the reception. It feels more like an apartment than a hotel. This location is perfect, and although you are right beside the Spanish Steps, it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellerathens
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for one night on December 2010 and we are planning on staying this January 2012 as well. Great location just a few meters from Spanish Steps. I totally recommend this hotel for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Merlion0711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night but wish it had been longer. We were in the Deluxe Triple Room which had plenty of room for 2 adults (the bed was very comfortable) and& 2 children and a big bathroom. The man at the front desk was genuinely welcoming and helpful, and the location couldn't be better for many of Rome's key tourist spots. Despite our room looking out over the Spanish Steps we had no problem with noise. I'd have given 5 stars if we'd been here for more than a day. As it is this will be our first choice hotel for any return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: MamaOfTheSeas
Reviews.Content: After much research on Tripadvisor, we booked with Relais Pierret, and were extremely happy that we did. The staff is so helpful and welcoming. The location is terrific, and it is easy to walk to everything. We loved the feeling of walking through the large doors to enter the building. We chose a room that did not overlook the Spanish steps. It was quiet and roomy. Our room was a "triple" with king size bed (they call it a double), a full bathroom, and a salon with a sofa bed and some chairs. Every room was spacious, clean and had high ceilings. The free wireless internet was terrific, and the air conditioning worked well. The bathroom had a toilet, bidet, sink, large shower/bathtub. The price was very reasonable for what we received. We had plenty of room and slept well. We would stay here again! Thanks to the staff at Relais Pierret for a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Location....”
Reviews.Author: travelwithpeggy
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for walking to the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon and many others. The rooms are large, comfortable and very clean. The bathrooms are modern and also large. We were there in the heat of summer and the air conditioner was quiet and worked very well. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I love my 3 nights at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ehp_9
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel , big rooms , the best location possible, right next to the spanish steps. The shopping is fantastic as all the major shops are within 5 minutes walk. Very friendly staff so overall good value for money will definitely stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful hotel, AMAZING service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mozwhite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a couple nights before heading to Tuscany. The hotel was immaculate and the location was fantastic. We stayed in the Deluxe Triple Room (323 sq ft), which was huge by European city standards, and it had a giant bathroom. The bed was firm and comfortable and wifi was free and it always worked. When you first arrive, it is a little tricky because reception is located on the 2nd floor and it isn't well marked. Even though it's next to the Spanish Steps, noise was never a problem for us. The proximity to the Metro makes this location even better. These things alone probably would have garnered 5 stars for me, but it was the service that made this hotel so fantastic. First, our flight was delayed multiple times and, when we finally arrived, the car we had arranged through the hotel was there to pick us up. Then, the airline lost my wife's luggage and not only did the hotel staff make many calls on our behalf while we were in Rome, they also continued to coordinate with staff from the villa's we stayed at in Tuscany during the rest of the trip. I cannot exaggerate how much that extra effort helped us to stay sane throughout our baggage ordeal. If only Alitalia's baggage people could provide even half the amount of customer service we received from the Relais Pierret!! This really is a great little hotel and I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for next time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Porkbun
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just a few steps from the Spanish steps, around the corner from the metro, across the street from via corso and yet is pretty quiet in the room. The hotel is clean. The room is comfortable and spacious for both bed and bath. The staffs are very helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: Christine551155
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right by the Spanish Steps. Rooms are lovely, with great ensuite, comfy beds, kettle/tea/coffee and a safe for your documents. No breakfast provided, but there are lots of local places you can pop out to for coffee and pastries. Taxi to Termini Station was 10 euros and bus ride to Forum was 1 euro. We mostly walked everywhere, as the sights are close together. A great place to visit and this hotel is a great starting point for your adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tallulah99
Reviews.Content: This is our second time to stay in this gorgeous residence and I can't see myself staying anywhere else in Rome. The staff are so helpful and friendly and the location is just ideal. The comfort and ambience are excellent. It's just a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Lovely Staff...”
Reviews.Author: napolia
Reviews.Content: The location is unbelievable, right on the Piazza di Spagna, steps away from the Metropolitana entrance. Our room actually had a view of the Spanish Steps - albeit from the side looking up. The front desk staff was wonderful. The Internet was fast and reliable. In general, the room seemed a little tired. The room was clean, but a tiny bit musty smelling. The beds were acceptable, but not great. The bathroom was lovely (in fact, the one *new* thing in the room), but the water pressure left something to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: MonaAlsaad
Reviews.Content: Everything was good the reception was very helpful Rooms was small and no breakfast I realy enjoy my stay in this hotel thanks for all the reception staff

Reviews.Title: “Just one simple word...AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Domenica_L
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a beautiful hotel in the centre of Rome, this is it. The Relais Pierret is located just seconds literally (maybe 10 metres) from the Spanish Steps. Its central location makes it walking distance to all of Romes famous site (Fountain of Trevi, Pantheon, Piazza del Popolo, Piazza Navona, etc), and tonnes of amazing places to shop (Via Condotti) and eat, at any price. The rooms were impeccably clean with very nice antique furniture, yet very modern bathroom facilties. The view from our window was of the Spanish Steps and a beautiful little courtyard on the neighboring building. Surprisingly enough we slept very well and the noise and buzz coming from the Spanish Steps was not a concern once our window was shut. The hotel also offers airport pickup and drop off which is very reasonably priced and the service was first class all the way. They picked up and dropped off right at the front door. The only disappointment about the hotel stay was that there was no breakfast included. Otherwise an amazing place to stay and well worth what we paid. You'll love it here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel - we'll be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: LizandMikeSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on a 'stop over' in Rome in mid-July. We have stayed in Rome before (Sofitel), and are disappointed we only found this hotel now. For the price, the location and comfort of the rooms is outstanding. And the prettiest corridor! All in all a better room than the Sofitel - at a far discounted price. The staff were also very obliging and welcoming. No, it's not a 5 star hotel - there is no room service and no staff on the front desk after 11.00 pm - but there is always someone on call, the hotel gives you a card and phone number to call should there be any problems. Our room was extremely quiet, even though it looked out onto the small side street that led to the Metro - always a steady stream of people coming and going. Breakfast was easy - my husband went to a local cafe and bought coffee and pastries 'to go' ... so we had a great breakfast in bed! Only two concerns. On arriving back at the hotel after 11.00 pm, our key wouldn't open the door. Luckily another guest returned at the same time, who let us in. I think we were doing something wrong, as when the staff checked the next morning the key worked. So maybe check you know how to use the key before you go out! Our other concern was that we asked the hotel to organise transport for us to and from the airport - it was at the same rate as taxis, so seemed the easiest way to go. But arriving and leaving both drivers were quite frightening. One was texting as he drove, and we missed an accident by centimetres. Both spoke on phones while driving and both insisted on driving at 130 kms (allowable on the freeways to the airport), but too fast for us. Both also tailgated at high speed. Yes, they did stop talking/texting when asked, and slowed down (a little) on our request - but begrudgingly. And we know how Italians drive, but this is a service provided for tourists, who I think would mostly feel the same way we did. Next time we'll take a taxi as we have done before, with no problems! But we willc ertainly stay at this hotel again - highly recommended if you want to be in this part of town - literally next door to Spanish Steps and walking distance to so many of Rome's sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hub in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AussieGoGirl
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel in the real sense of the word there is no front entrance or lobby and no concierge - but it's not a B&B either, as breakfast was not included in our room tariff. It is however a great place to stay. It's right on the Piazza and the staff who were there were polite and attentive when needed and the room was always scrupulously clean. The size of the room was HUGE by Italian standards I was very impressed considering the location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is happy to travel independently, look after themselves in regards to restaurant reservations and breakfast and does not need the services of concierge or 24hour reception.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: AM&AP
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights recently after having spent a lot of time searching online for the "perfect" hotel in Rome. And I think that we found it. The hotel is a few doors down from the Spanish Steps, and although Piazza di Spagna is crowded practically all the time, the rooms are quiet and cosy. Not having a place for breakfast at the hotel was not a problem, as there are countless cafes in the area where you can eat... and even more a slightly further walk away. The hotel provided us with a list of restaurants and cafes which had been recommended by other guests, and each and every one of these places we tried were wonderful. With free WiFi, we were able to plan our days while in our room, and any questions we had were helpfully answered by everyone on the front desk. We were even allowed to use the computer to check in for our flight back and print off the boarding passes. Excellent service! The only slightly small downside was the bed. Although it was comfortable, it seemed to be higher in the middle, and sloped downwards towards the sides of the bed, resulting in waking a few times on the first night feeling I was falling out of bed. But on the second night, I had already got used to it. When in Rome again, we will certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay over the weekend”
Reviews.Author: 2bwyou
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, comfortable and clean room, friendly staff coupled with the nice weather on the weekend made this stay a memorable one. Would definitely return to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Tara134
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. There are only 6 rooms at 1st floors. Every room very clean and nice furnished. Staff is very friendly and helpful. You are able to walk to best placed in Rome. If you go by car, you may park at Parking Via Ludovisi, only 10 min. to walk to Relais Pierret. You find nice bars and restaurants around. Metro is directly near by Relais Pierret. There is nothing negative, but if you look for a hotel with American breakfast, lobby, pool, spa etc. you have to look for another location. This place is perfect for weekend stay. Feel like at home, not as hotel guest.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as 2 years ago”
Reviews.Author: MacD_of_Perth
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here in September 2007. We returned because it was so good, and it was pleasing to find that nothing has changed. Location. Location. Location. The best shopping is right outside, as are lots of good restaurants both cheap and cheerful as well as up-market. Clean accommodation. Safe. Intelligent and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rshorrocks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Rome having had an amazing time in the 'city that never sleeps'. The trip was made very special by the hotel that we were in. First things first this is not a hotel in the traditional sense of the word. There is no room service or restaurants in the hotel, it is the facility of a room in a great location. The hotel is indeed situated no more than 25meters from the Spanish steps in the Piazza di Spagna. When you arrive you need to go upto the 1st floor to check in. There is a small lift or stair case. We arrived around 2pm and the room was ready for us to check in. We were in room 106 which was a lovely superior double room. There was a massive double bed, side tables, wardrobe and dressing table with a traditional feel. The furniture was made of cherry with green damask coverings. The bathroom was very nice with a subtle modern feel with sink, loo, bidet and shower. The room was clean and nicely presented with the cleaners having done a thorough job. Every day we were there the room was made up well whilst we were sight seeing. The thing that struck us was that the room whilst not large felt large which may have been down to the high ceiling. There was also a fridge, safe, airconditioning and TV in the room. I am a light sleeper so I unpluged the fridge at night to prevent the compressor waking me. The key factor with the hotel like all things is the people who run it. The team was outstanding, a lovely small team of four people. Nothing was too much trouble for them and every enquiry was met with a smile and a can do approach regardles of the stupidty of the question. They make this hotel the gem it is and a very pleasent stay in Rome, it is a daunting thing visiting a foreign city for the first time and not speaking the language fully and the team at the hotel made it easy and very pleasent. The hotel is in an ideal position and there is very little that you can not visit on foot and avoid useing the white cabs (never accept that there is a fixed rate and they will try to rip you off). The Vatican was a 30minute walk away and the Trevi fountain 10minute walk away, so long as you do not get lost on the way!!!! Also the tube line is a 1minute walk from the hotel, and a 75minute ticket will cost you only 1euro !!!! The hotel supplies a little booklet in the room listing all sorts of different restaurants around different locations in the city. We found this very useful and it helped us make decisions about where we were going to eat. There are so many different places to eat that you are spoilt for choice. Our tip would be the Do Bar for breakfast (15 euros for 2 people) and the Osteria Margutta for a lovely supper in a lovely retaurant (100euros for 2 people). We did a Private Tour of the Vatican which we had been recommended to do and I would strongly recommend that if you are visiting the Vatican you do this. The queues are huge and the private tour skips all these and you get a very personal tour instead of being in a group of 25. DO NOT do any tour of the Coloseum it is not worth it, the audio guide supplies you with all the information you need. I would recommend a tour of the Roman Forum & Palatine Hill as there is so much to see and understand. The Italians have not made this area very user friendly and it is very confused even with an audio guide. Also the toilet facilities are not the most pleasent for a lady. If you are visiting the coloseum the tip is to buy your ticket at the Palatine hill entrance the queue was minimal with only 3 couples ahead of us. The ticket you buy can cover all three places and is 2minutes walk from the coloseum. Armed with said ticket you can return to the coloseum and walk past the queue which stretches around the monument straight to the front. We did not book our visits with the hotel but they can organise them for you. If the car we organised with the hotel to take us back to the airport was any example then you wont be disappointed. It is an amazing city and we will be visiting again as there is so much to see. We would highly recommend the Relais Pierret as a base to stay and visit the city. Great job and we will see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Alex was great !!!”
Reviews.Author: bageguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Relais Pierret. It's a great location, close to the metro and all of the sites. Alex was extremely helpful with restaurant choices and went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed. By European standards the room was amble in size and very comfortable. Would definitely stay there again. Thanks Alex!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Ruby258
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and just returned from a fabulous vacation in Rome. We stayed at the Relais Pierret for 6 nights and an additional 2 nights on our return back from Florence before returning to the States. Although the Releis Pierret was not our first choice, we were very pleased with our stay. We arrived late after 7pm and our rooms were ready as they were expecting us. Same with our return stay. This is not a complete full service property with a restaurant, room service, fitness center and pool etc… however the staff went above and beyond and offered suggestions and worked hard to accommodate our needs. Alex was truly a “rock star”. He was quite often at the desk during our stay and always extended his service with a smile. I have stayed in numerous 3-5 star hotels and rarely encounter the exceptional level of service provided. The rooms were spacious and clean. Cleanliness and updated furnishings were very important to us in our search for accommodations. We had 3 adults in a triple room and it was large enough for an extra bed and luggage space. The bed was comfortable. The furnishings were antique Italian /modern. The water pressure in the shower was good. The rooms and amenities were well maintained. The room pictures posted by other guests are true to how the rooms actually appear. The windows do open for fresh air. The elevator was small but this is standard throughout Europe. The building is located near Spanish Steps and the square was very crowded. We could hear some outside noise in our room but was not loud enough to bother us. It was quiet during the evening and we slept well. The air conditioning unit kept our room cool and was quiet. The Relais Pierret is located right next to the Spanish Steps with easy access to the metro stop Spagna. Thank you to other reviewers that specified the exact building and location. This really helped us in pinpointing the location upon arrival. Also, it was easy walking to many nearby trattorias, cafes and shopping. There is a grocery store located nearby (5 min walk) which was great for picking up water and snacks. We walked everywhere and used the metro to visit sights further away. We have found our home in Rome and will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, brilliant staff, wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: ThreeBillies
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was a real pleasure. Alex on the front desk was a star, as were all of his colleagues. The front desk took pride in their hotel and their city and were unfailing in their help to navigate the city, make restaurant reservations and do all they could to make our visit smooth and enjoyable. The hotel itself is an historical gem and the location is fabulous - having a key to a grand-looking door right on the Spanish Steps feels very special. Rome is one of our favourite places, and we won't be staying anywhere else in the future. Many thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious room for European hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cspoe7
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a centrally located, reasonably priced hotel to explore the wonderful city of Rome, and we were not disappointed by our choice in the Relais Pierret. The room was quiet and spacious and the staff was very friendly and helpful, offering recommendations for places to eat (and for super markets to get stuff for our infant) and helping to book a tour of the Vatican as well as booking transportation back to the airport. It was a pleasant surprise to find upon arriving that the hotel that they offered free internet service. The location of the hotel next to the Spanish Steps was great; within reasonable walking distance of many sites (including the Hard Rock Cafe and Harley-Davidson dealer), and a very short walk to the Metro to get to more remote sites like the Vatican (3 metro stops away) and the Colosseum (5 stops with 1 switch). No breakfast is provided, but that's not a big deal as there are many places to eat in the area. As an aside, one place I would strongly discourage anyone from frequenting is the Cardesi SRL gelateria near the Spanish Steps (see my review at http://rome-hotels.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g187791-i22-k2327175-l17444440-Gelati_by_the_Spanish_Steps-Rome_Lazio.html for more information), as we were among the many that establishment has ripped off. Overall, we were very happy with our stay here and would consider the Relais Pierret again if we come back to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: WalesBlodyn
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Relais Pierret and cannot recommend these apartments highly enough. Location just by the Spanish Steps is ideal for visiting all the main tourist attractions by foot but there is also a metro station just 1 minute around the corner. Piazza di Spagna is a bustling and vibrant Piazza giving a wonderful holiday feel. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very spacious. The staff were friendly and very helpful, always willing to give advise and any help required. We highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “You can stop looking; you will not find a better overall Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: faxwell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Relais Pierret Piazza di Spagna, and I think that I can save you the hours that we spent looking for just the right place in Rome for your perfect stay -- this is it. The location is, as you have read, on the piazza at the Spanish Steps. As you face the steps, at the bottom, immediately to the left is the famous Babbington's Tea Room. This building is to the left of that. It was built in 1800 (or so), but with a lift and beautiful common areas in the hotel. The rooms and facilities are very modern, clean and comfortable. The Spanish Steps are alive with people, so that you find yourselves in a very lively part of town. The hotel is just far enough to the side that you are not walking through crowds to get to it. Although there is street noise at night, if you notice it, it stops before it is too late because, like any public space in Rome with lots of people, there is a casual police presence. We never saw any trouble there. Around the corner from the hotel is an entrance to the Metro. With a little investigation, you could easily take the train from the airport to the Termini station, then switch to the Metro and arrive nearly at the hotel door. The Metro has a couple of exits some streets apart, so this was not clear to me (before we went) and we arranged for transportation from the airport, but on the way back we went by Metro because it is so close and convenient. We walked nearly everywhere that we wanted to go, so we only used the Metro to get on time to early tours at the Vatican Museums and the Palatine Hill. This hotel is very well located if you want to walk the city to sights. It felt good to walk off some of the great meals we had. Of course, the expensive retail shops are in the streets nearby, and it is always entertaining to window shop, when they are closed, on the way back to the hotel. I cannot say enough about the staff. There are hotel staff that are helpful, and then there are staff like the ones at this hotel that really take it to the next level (or two). One of the most helpful things they did was to recommend restaurants and to make reservations. Without exception, we were recommended to charming local inexpensive restaurants, and with our reservations came excellent treatment. I have an allergy that I could never adequately explain at restaurants, but that issue was always clear with the reservation. One reservation was at a restaurant that, we were told, was touristy but that they (the staff) ate there. We went in, tried to explain to a waiter that we had a reservation, but were seated with other tourists, which seemed natural enough. But I wanted to be certain that it was clear who we were so they knew I was the one with the allergy, and when an english speaking waiter (not our first one there) found out about our reservation, he told us that our table was upstairs. We were escorted to a table upstairs where the customers were all local Italians and where the service was remarkably better. I attribute this to the staff recommendation, naturally, and give it to you as an example of how they can make a difference in your Rome experience. Truly, there are countless fine hotels in Rome. I am simply saying here that you can rest assured that you have found one that will exceed your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for quiet romance, do not stay here on a weekend!”
Reviews.Author: starrey
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for one night. We arrived in Rome, dropped off our bags and started exploring. The location is great because it is within walking distance to a lot of great places. But when we got tired and the jetlag caught up with us we returned to the hotel to sleep only to be kept awake until early morning by the party on the Spanish Steps. For hours there was cheering, screaming, clapping, singing, etc. which felt like it was happening right beside our room. The front desk said they could not move us since the hotel was full but offered to get us another room if we wanted to stay a few extra nights which was a really weird solution considering we had such a bad experience - why would we want to extend our stay? I'm not sure what this place is like during the week but if you want somewhere to get to sleep before midnight on a weekend - this isn't the spot for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AlNic
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent Hotel and the staff were great. This is the second time we have been to Rome and I don't think you can beat the location of this hotel. The reviews speak for themselves and should we go to Rome again we know where we will be stopping

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Service, Excellent Hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: Bollywood-Princess
Reviews.Content: Having read the other reviews on here, this hotel seemed to be the best option for us, once we got there we were definitely not disappointed!! The location was fantastic (literally on the Spanish Steps!), we were walking distance to the most of the main attractions and just 3 stops on the metro from the vatican. The room was better than we'd expected and much larger (don't be fooled by the reviews that say the rooms are small), the bathroom was immaculate and all the little touches made it even better. the rooms were extremely clean and very very comfortable. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We had booked an evening flight back and they let us stay in the room for most of the day (even though check-out was earlier). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Rome. I honestly couldn't fault a thing, and would definitely stay there again! The only thing that put a downer on the trip was our flight back being cancelled, due to the snow, but again the Guest Relations Manager was brilliant and immediately booked us into another room (into Internatiozional Dormus) which was on the 3rd floor, again the room was lovely (slightly smaller than the one downstairs) but nonetheless of the same immaculate condition and cleanliness. What I would say to anyone going to Rome for the first time is when you do go out to eat check the prices on the menus as one of the cafe's tried to charge us 60 euros for a plate of Spaghettie and an omelette. Eating and drinking is exceptionally expensive (between 6-10 euros for a glass of coke or orange juice). But apart from that, fantastic hotel, and we had a brilliant time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PASeamus
Reviews.Content: This was the least expensive hotel and least fancy from our trip to Italy, but it was by far my favorite. The hotel is in a great location. We walked everywhere but to the Vatican. The hotel was wonderful in their service even before arriving. They made arrangements for transportation from the airport, a vatican tour with a private guide and offered wonderful dinner recommendations for my birthday. Upon arrival, they met us at the door and took us straight to our room. The room was the quad room with 2 bedrooms and one and a half baths. I can't tell you how clean it was. Just immaculate. Included in the minimal price were robes and slippers. I love slippers in a hotel. We had the room with the balcony overlooking Piazza di Spagna. I quite enjoyed our view. Although the hotel did not include or have facilities for breakfast, coffee and pastries were just a short walk away. The only thing missing was perhaps a comfy chair. The only chair in the room was the desk chair. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: BrianWidnes
Reviews.Content: I went to Rome with my wife and daughter. We made our own travel arrangements so needed a hotel in a central location but not costing the earth. We were quite certain of what we were looking for. Priorities being, location, cleanliness, cost, good reviews and not paying for facilities that we wouldn't use. We certainly hit the target with all of these. The hotel is situated on the first floor of an old but tastefully and classily decorated building. The staff are very pleasant, attentive and obliging. We had the triple room which was right opposite receiption and hardly heard any noise when we went to bed. The room was perfectly adequate and the bathroom, (don't forget I'm travelling with two females), needed to be good and it was better than good. You come out of your hotel door and you are on the street at the bottom of the Spanish Steps and 50 yards away from the Metro. Other major sites are close by within walking distance. One word of caution though and that's be prepared for excessive food and drink prices in restaraunts. Some charging as much as twelve euros for a bottle of local beer. Pizza is as good as anything and McDonalds is cheap enough as often as you can manage it. Travelling in January is great to avoid the crowds and as long as you dress warm you'll be fine. The hotel have big umbrellas that you can take out if it rains. A nice touch I thought. An open top bus tour is about 18 euro for one day and 24 for two and is a great way to get around - hop on and hop on. Pick the red buses. Far more reliable and better equiped than the others.

Reviews.Title: “Romance at the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Poushie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an amazing 7 days in Rome to celebrate New Years Eve and have a romantic holiday. I did a lot of reseach on hotels in Rome as i have visited Rome many times but have always stayed with relatives far from the city so I wanted the best location and a comfortable room for 7 days. After reading all the positive reviews on trip advisor i chose the Relais Pierret for location and the size of the room. Neither one disappointed us. From beginning to end the hotel offered excellent service from their very quick replies to my emails and their useful information on restaurants etc in Rome. The hotel was at first hard to find as we had an airline car transfer that dropped us off at the wrong hotel but if you are facing the spanish steps its the building to your left with the boutique Furla next to the large front doors that lead to the 8 quaint rooms on level 1 of the building. Our room was larger than expected - the bed was one of the most comfortable we have slept in - it consisted of 2 twin beds which I think are zipped together to form one large very comfortable bed with 4 pillows (2 firm and 2 soft). The bathroom had 2 separate basins and were separated by another door so you had his/her bathrooms - one had the bathtub and basin and the other room had the toilet, bidet and basin. Again another reason why i would stay at this hotel again. The ceilings were around 18 feet high which gave us a greater feeling of space. We were fortunate not to have any loud guests during our stay as you can hear the footsteps down the corridor and any chatting but this would not deter us from staying here. Rome during New Years Eve is amazing.... the atmosphere is incredible and the weather was cold and clear so we were able to spend the night ouside at the open air concert ouside of the Colosseum and then sit at the Fountain of Trevi at 2am eating pizza and drinking campari. An unforgettable night. It was comforting returning to our hotel each evening to our lovely room which felt like home after 7 days. I dont think you can find a better location than the Spanish steps for sightseeing, restaurants, the best shopping in the city and the Metro was 1 minute walk from the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples and singles.

Reviews.Title: “close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: mymUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the hot month of August, but had no problems at all. The airconditioning was working, the windows are double-glazed, so insulate well against both the heat/cold and the noise - very quiet despite Spanish steps next door. The front desk staff are very knowledgeable and helpful. Thank you! And the price was a nice bonus - not that many reasonably-sized, refurbished rooms in Rome for this price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: 4MillionMilesLater
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one door away from the foot of the Spanish Steps so the location for tourists is hard to beat. The room was generous is size, but could have benefited from a comfortable chair. The staff was extremely helpful in all respects. There are too issues with the Relais Perriet: If you have a room on the south side of the hotel facing the Spanish Steps, crowd noise at night outside your room can be a real problem, and closing the windows won't solve it. Also the air conditioning units are not very effective in dealing with Rome's often sultry weather.

Reviews.Title: “Too hot!”
Reviews.Author: luvseurope6
Reviews.Content: If it was not for having no A/C on 90 degree days, I would have rated this hotel much higher. We were there in September and it was unusually hot for Rome. We were travelling with friends who also stayed there and had no A/C in their room either. We asked the staff to look into it. They came into both rooms and tried to work the remote which operates the A/C, but to no avail. If you are staying in Rome during cooler months I would recommend this hotel. The location is excellent. The rooms are spotless, bed is comfortable, and bathrooms are large.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: spanishfly77
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights here at the start of our honeymoon. The location of this clean, well-maintained hotel was very central and convenient. While the hotel doesn't serve breakfast, the kitchenette in our room allowed us to make breakfast ourselves. I loved walking out of the main doors to find crowds of people sitting on the Spanish Steps. The room was large and the bed was extremely comfortable. I slept over 10 hours each night which is very rare for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, central with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: NG-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four days in August 2008. The position couldn't be better for the sights; right on the Piazza di Spagna at the bottom of the Spanish Steps though not particularly noisy inside. This is not a full-service hotel but appartments with daily service set in a pleasant, nicely decorated building with exceptionally helpful reception staff. The room was very comfortable, large bed, air conditioning, fridge and complimentary drinks/nibbles and a good bathroom. There's a complimentary internet terminal in the hall and free wireless/cable internet in the rooms. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, explaining the routine, suggesting restaurants and generally helping out. Would go back tomorrow and highly recommend this

Reviews.Title: “Loved Relais Pierret”
Reviews.Author: rhwilliams
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here. It is a great location, right next to the Spanish Steps and the metro. Alex was so helpful. The accommodations were wonderful. We will definitely recommend this place to others!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Take my word for it...
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one building to the left of the Spanish Steps just over a Furla purse store. The location is ideal. The rooms are small, but feel more spacious because the ceilings are sky high. The bathroom is nicely done and there is plenty of airconditioning. The hotel has charm, fabulous staff who are happy to provide suggestions, arrange tours and answer all your questions. The hotel staff arranged guided tours of the Vatican and the Colleseum for us and the addtional cost was well worth it. Boris Regner was our guide and he was terrific (incredibly knowledgeable, speaks fluent English and a pleasure to spend time with). With the guide (a cost of 170 euros for three hours) we gained easy access to the venues (no waiting in line) and learned as much or as little as we wanted. The hotel staff has a little handbook of suggested restaurants to visit. Their breakfast suggestions are not good. As the saying goes, when in Rome... eat a pastry and have at cappucino at a neighbourhood coffee place. American Breakfasts are terrible and we quickly learned not worth the money. We ate at a place called Veccia Roma for dinner. It was delicious. There are lots of little places not far from the hotel that are yummy. Go for dinner around 8:30 p.m. If you see Italians eating there that's a good sign. The hotel is a Relais property and is known as Internationale Domus. I'm used to 5 star properties and while this didn't have all the modern touches of the Savoy in Florence, it was exactly what I wanted. Tons of charm, very clean and the BEST LOCATION in Rome. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very homey atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: babyili
Reviews.Content: My husbant and I selected this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed! Immediatelly after our booking via internet, I received an email from the hotel asking us if we would like to be picked up from the airport...always answer yes to this (I will explain later)!!!!! Upon our arrival at the hotel the consierge was very kind and helpfull providing us with a map and a list of the best places to eat around Rome. The hotel is in the heart of Rome, right next to the Spanish Steps, however the rooms are very quiet. The bed was enormous, the pillows soft and fluffy and the bed linen clean and of very good quality. The bathroom was big and spotless, there was always hot water and clean towels. Althoug the hotel does not provide breakfast there are many places around piazza di Spagna where you can eat something, the hotel recomends some of them. We stayed at the hotel just for one night, however the day of our departure the kept our luggage and allowed us to freshen up in the bathroom before our departure. Excactly at the time agreed our driver was at the hotel to pick us up. I would recommend to anyone staying in the center of Rome to arrange with the hotel to be picked up from the airport. We decided to take the train not because of the cost but because we thought it would be faster. It was a huge mistake!!! We ended up standing the whole trip fro the airport to termini station packed with other standing travellers some of them not so fond of cleanliness! At the station we got a taxi and from the 1st minute we understood that the Taxi driver would rip us off. For a 10 min drive he demanded 25 Euros and when we gave him a 20 and a 5 euro bills he switched them for two 5 euro bills and pretended that we owe him more!!!!! Old trick !!! Trust the hotel stuff when they recommend Osteria de la Marguta...AMAZING!!! Try the tortelini with tartufo!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maureen19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon in May 2008. What a great place! The staff was absolutely charming and helpful and the room was terrific. We've booked many rooms on the internet, and this was one of the few hotels in Europe where the picture on the website was the actual room we stayed in. What a nice surprise. The room was spacious, immaculate, and very well appointed. The bathroom was first class, and the soaking tub was a nice feature for our sore feet after the end of a long day of sightseeing in Rome. As far as location, it was perfectly situated within walking distance of all major sites and even though it was right next to the Spanish Steps, the rooms were soundproofed so well that we never heard the crowds that would congregate there in the evenings. We will absolutely stay here again when we return to Rome and want to say a special thank you to Alex for his great recommendations and for ensuring that we had an excellent time! What a beautiful city! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tobinrose
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome and Stayed at the Relais pierret for my 30th birthday and we had a wonderful time.As most of the other reviews say,the front of house staff were extremly helpful,they recommend restaurants and show you on the map where the supermarket is etc.Also we arrived about 2hours early,but they got our room ready and we were in within 15 mins. The location is execellent right next to the spanish steps a really pretty location. The room was lovely and clean with nice little touches like slippers and water and juice in the fridge. The only negative i have is that it is quite noisey in the morning because all the rooms and reception are all on the same floor. Rome itself was beautiful, but really really HOT.As everything in rome was extremly expensive fill up when ever you can at the water fountins.My top tip would be pre book the collseum on line,it is a little more expensive,but you bypass all the queues,which is a must in the stifling heat!and take plently of money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: traveliskey
Reviews.Content: As far as location goes it's absolutely perfect. Actually next to the Spanish Steps and in the heart of the expensive shopping district, you can walk to nearly all the attractions in Rome from this amazing location. As for the hotel itself... the rooms were lovely and quite spacious for a European hotel, even including the bathroom. The beds were large and oh so comfortable, the airconditioning worked a treat on the hotest of days and the front of house staff were superb, both helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Don't worry that there is no breakfast included in this hotel - you are right in the thick of things so try a new cafe' every day and get a good tast of what Rome has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bear007
Reviews.Content: The Relais Pierret is the perfect place to stay. Firstly, the staff were fantastic. Professional, but very approachable and personable. The location of the hotel doesn't get any better. It is right next to the Spanish Steps. You walk out of the hotel and onto the Piazza di Spagna. It's right around the corner from the subway and surrounded by restuarants, cafes, and the most exclusive shopping strip iin Rome. The rooms were beautifully clean. The bathroom was spotless with a great shower and water presssure and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The room had an LCD TV, free internet access, double glazed windows and heavy curtains to ensure you didn't wake too early in the morning. On arrival, the hotel provided a wonderful directory of special/authentic restaurants to try which proved to be invaluable. A couple of places in particular were very very special and very very well priced. They were: Nino - refer to the directory for the address. and details. The only thing I would add is that you must get the hotel to make a reservation. The food is FANTASTIC and the staff were wonderful. Sora Margherita - A place you must experience for lunch. It is in the Jewish Ghetto area and the food was fantastic. Don't order off the menu, let the staff arrange the specials of the day for you. Make sure you ask Alex how to get there as it's a little tricky. This is not a traditional hotel in the sense that they don't have a restaurant and as a consequence don't have breakfast or room service etc. However, who cares!! We never eat in hotels except for breakfast. Get out and experience all of the amazing foods that this WONDERFUL city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best location!”
Reviews.Author: Mitzel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Pierret from May 3-5 and it is the perfect location. Right along the Piazza di Spagna and about 20 steps from the Spanish Steps. Across the square is a shopping haven. You have Via Condotti which has all the designer shops like Gucci, LV etc. The metro is beside Relais and the police and carabinieri are everywhere, making it safe even late at night. The rooms are beautifully decorated and the bathrooms are spacious. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We decided to fly to Rome a day ahead of schedule and asked them if they could give us an additional night. They were fully booked but Alex was gracious enough to walk around the area just to find another hotel that was available and near the Relais just so I wouldn't have a hard time transferring to their hotel. He even called me through my mobile to arrange everything. Talk about extra service! This is the only place I'm staying in if and when I go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in eternal city”
Reviews.Author: bikerprof
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room with balcony overlooking the square. Hotel efficient and friendly, and no problems of any kind. Staff happy to assist with local queries. As others have said, the location is the crowning glory. Access to internet also a help!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem at the foot of the Spanish Steps......”
Reviews.Author: Jayney1
Reviews.Content: We were lookiing for somewhere very special to celebrate my birthday and our anniversary and we found it! A fabulous property in a wonderful location with extremely helpful staff who were happy to attend to our every need. The hotel is exceptional ly clean and well maintained, a fridge with welcome drinks is supplied and also a kettle and TV. We felt very welcome and at home! You have your own key to come and go as you please but still experience the feeling of being looked after... it is great to open the front door onto a vibrant piazza where everything is at your fingertips...taxis, horse and carriage, the metro and whichever direction you choose to walk in are within easy reach of all of Rome's wonderful sights. The Via Condotti opposite and the adjoining streets and piazzas offer something for everyone...fantastic shops, wonderful restaurants and the living museum which is Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, location and room”
Reviews.Author: IVernazza
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome on April 10th and it was raining. We shared a taxi with people we knew and ran into from California who happened to be in Rome to catch a cruise. I had booked the Relais months ahead of time to ensure I got a good room for three people. When I booked, the exchange rate was $1.37 > Euro, but when I arrived, it was $1.56. Regardless, we had a nice room. We had two comfortable twin beds and a good sofa sleeper. Plenty of room and a large modern bath. Our room had a large window that looked towards the Spanish Steps but all we could see was an outdoor patio and a wall that separated the steps from the building, but you could easily see the window from the steps. No complaints. I slept next to the open window and heard a little noise going on outside but it did not disturb my sleep. My sister is a very light sleeper and she had no problems either. The Hotel is on the first floor (2nd floor in the States) and there is an elevator to take you up. Our room was directly across from the check in desk but it was never noisy. The desk closes at about 10:00 pm and is re-staffed at about 9:00 am. They provide you with phone numbers - just in case. There is no breakfast but they will give you a card to go to a much overpriced tea room for breakfast (25E) and recommend other locations in the area. There is a mini refrigerator and they stocked it with three bottles of fruit juice and a basket of teas, coffee and toast- but they do not replenish it. We had to ask for coffee and tea on the third day. There is also interest access so we were able to check weather reports, train schedules, etc. The rain stopped at the end of the second day. We had a wonderful time in Rome and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It was a great location and everyone was happy with the room. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. Staff was very nice and helpful. I have been to Rome a few times and you really need to pay attention to room descriptions and locations. You can get a room that is less expensive, but if you are use to US type hotels, you may be disappointed. This hotel is much like staying at a brand hotel in the States but on a small scale. The furniture was in good shape (not 1960's era), the wallpaper did not have any stains (common occurrence in Rome) and the ceiling in the main hall was beautifully painted. I mention this because I have stayed at many locations in Italy paying large hotel prices for a Motel 6 type room. Just keep in mind everything is expensive in a large city and this is no different that New York. I would stay here again and recommend the location to friends. My only complaint is that I feel they should have re-stocked drinks (bottles and pkgs).

Reviews.Title: “great location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mlrds
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our wedding anniversary. Our room (Donatello) was lovely and had a great view of the Spanish Steps, especially pretty due to the pink and white azeleas in bloom on the steps. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, especially Alex. The location is great and we walked to several tourist attractions easily from here, I.e. Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. Overall great place to stay in Rome would recommend it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl8008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two pre-teen kids. We decided on the Relais Pierret based on the reviews of the hotel. It was in a perfect location. It is right on the Spanish Steps, next to a metro stop, and in a very nice area. The children had their own room and bathroom which is rare for a European hotel. It is not like a regular hotel with all the amenities. Only apartment style rooms, small check-in office, and a computer. We would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with older children. The only con is the guys in the Piazza di Spagna trying to sell junk toys. If you are firm with them they leave you alone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Onthego088
Reviews.Content: I booked the Relais Pierret, Rome based purely on the reviews on trip advisor. I am so glad because after exploring Rome for 3 days, this was a perfect choice for our room. It is based in one on the best locations, right by the Spanish steps, which is a lovely, clean and 'upmarket' area. This is ideal if you want a place the rest/sleep as it is just a 'room' - NOT a hotel. However, the room was lovely and clean and the reception staff gave us really useful advice and were so friendly. They even booked a nice restuarant for us which we'd had recomended. I would definately return to the Relais Pierret if i'm lucky enough to return to this amazing city again. I did throw my coin in the Trevi fountain so hopefully one day......!

Reviews.Title: “You can stop looking--This is the hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWerty
Reviews.Content: You can stop your relentless search for the perfect hotel in Rome right now. This is the one. I spent hours researching and looking for the perfect hotel to stay with my wife for a surprise trip. Luckily, I found Relais Pierret. It is everything you want in a Roman hotel. First, the location is perfect--just next to the Spanish Steps. You walk out right into the Piazza. It is right around the corner from the subway and surrounded by restuarants, cafes, and shops. Second, the hotel itself just feels like Rome. When you travel to Rome, you don't want to stay in some corporate hotel room. You want to feel like you live there. Here, you enter through 15 foot wooden doors and climb one flight of marble stairs. The hallway is beautifully painted and maintained. The rooms are beautiful. The ceilings are 20 feet high. The windows are 10 feet. The furnishings are perfect. While still maintaining its charm, each room has every amenity you would want without feeling like you are staying in a large chain hotel. You have a LCD television, heat and air con. operated by a remote control and a small frig, but you do not lose that feeling that you are staying small Roman villa. The bathroom was large. The water pressure was great. The bed was extremely comfortable. Every day our room was spotless. We stayed in a king-size bedroom, but the staff let us see the 4 person room. It would be great for a family with the balcony overlooking the piazza. The king-sized room was a very good size for a European hotel room. Finally, and most importantly, I cannot even express how fantastic the hotel staff was--especially Alex. Alex arranged for a car to pick us up and take us to the airport at 3 AM. He arranged for a private tour of the Vatican with a great guide, recommended restaurants. He helped my wife with a doctor visit when she became ill. He just made us feel welcome and at home. The staff truly cares about their job and making sure your stay is enjoyable. You can waste countless hours researching hotels and reading reviews (believe me I have done it), but you are just wasting your time. You should just book Relais Pierret, and move on to playing the rest of your trip. The hotel part will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellover56
Reviews.Content: We loved this small hotel located right next to the Spanish Steps. It has 8 hotel rooms on the second floor, and apartments for longer stays on the third floor. The hotel rooms are large, beautifully decorated and have modern bathrooms and mini refrigerators stocked with complimentary juice and water. We had a real king size bed. The common area on the second floor, painted with charming frescoes, has a computer for guests' use. Best of all was the helpful, knowledgeable and accessible staff. Their recommendations for restaurants were excellent, and they knew or found out the answers to our many questions (e.g., where can I buy a phone card, what time is the tour of the Ghetto, will I get trampled at the futbol game). The location is ideal for tourists, right next to a metro stop (good for getting to the train station and the Vatican), cab stands, lovely shops, and all the tourist sites in central Rome are an easy walk from here. I will definitely stay at Relais Pierret again when I return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Relais Pierret”
Reviews.Author: Weekender4
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a most enjoyable weekend at the Relais Pierret - 3 couples celebrating 40th birthdays. The beautiful location of the hotel, most attentive, friendly and efficient reception staff together with fabulous restaurants and endless sightseeing provided an unforgettable weekend. Thank you to the Relais Pierret for making our visit so special - we shall be returning! NB the hotel's umbrellas were also greatly appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in hotel service”
Reviews.Author: roove
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 9 nights and found a consistently high standard standard of service. At all times, we were impressed that the staff showed a genuine desire to provide whatever assistance they could to enhance not just our stay in this lovely hotel but overall our visit to this beautiful city. When one of our party became ill, their concern and efforts were exceptional. We think this is a very high quality and amenity to cost ratio hotel. Would certainly and unhesitatingly recommend it to friends and we will come again. Barb and Ruve

Reviews.Title: “Right beside spanish steps and still very quiet”
Reviews.Author: deekdeek
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place to stay, very cosy and modern. A free bottle of water and orange juice in your room when you arrive. our was vey nice and the staff very helpful they all have very good english we would stay here again if we where going back. It is so central to everythihg.

Reviews.Title: “Home in Rome - for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: alannd
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a fantastic location. The hotel is only a few paces from the Spanish Steps and the exclusive designer stores of Versace, Armani, D&G and Gucci (and a lot more). At the side of the hotel is the Metro station, only 3 stops to the Central Rome Railway Station and then the Leonardo Express non-stop train to the Airport. Alex on reception was willing to answer all questions and was extremely helpful with restaurants and directions. The hotel provides a useful handout in English full of restaurant ideas and other info. The free wireless internet is an excellent feature, that all hotels should provide. The extra of a PC in the hall for guests to use was great and allowed us to check in to our flights from the Hotel the night before. This hotel has no lounge, bar or resaturant. But thanks to the location you won't miss that too much, but then we were only there for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: CookingMama
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - it really made our break in Rome. With no restaurant, the hotel feels more like an apartment - we stayed in the 4 person suite as we were travelling with two small children. The location was fantastic with plenty of places to eat within wandering distance. The staff were all very helpful and the balcony overlook the Piazza di Spagna was the highlight of our stay. We would definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: johnnyschlom
Reviews.Content: Having booked this on line I wasn't quite sure what to expect. However I was impressed by the fact they called me 3 weeks before hand to see if we would like a car to meet us at the airport. Of course I had checked reviews and seen some photies but was non the less apprehensive. I need not have worried at all. The hotel is in the most perfect location right next to the Spanish Steps and just in front of the magnificent Villa Borghese. It is surrounded by great cafes and restaurants and shops. Walk everywhere. We did everything apart from the Vatican on foot. The Colosseum is a mere 20 minutes away and on route there are a feast of fountains and amazing architecture. Even our 10 year old loved wondering around and taking it all in. There is a supermarket just 2 minutes from the hotel where you can stock up on nibbles and very cheap and very good wine for a picnic in the park. We were greeted by the charming Alessandro who gave us a fact sheet with everything you need to know for your stay. He even gave us his mobile number should we hit any problems. He gave us plenty of advice and told us the we could go on line for free and make local calls for nothing too. The fridge was stocked with juice and water and we could make hot drinks and nibble on biscuits, melba toast and jams which were all provided. Our suite was perfect. Beautiful and luxurious decor. High ceilings, windows you could fling open, air conditioning and a flat screen tv should you feel the need to keep in contact with the outside world. I truly could not believe that we had hit on something so good. I cannot recommend this highly enough and we are already planning to return. Rome is a very special place and so much cheaper than I expected. Grecos is pricey but well worth a visit for coffee and cake. TheVerde got the big thumbs up for lunch and dinner. Thank you to all who made our first visit to Rome so memorable. .

HotelInfo.Name: Relais Pierret Piazza di Spagna
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza di Spagna 20, 00187 Rome, Italy
